avalancheActivity.comment: No reports of slab avalanches but few loose avalanches fell in the new snow
avalancheActivity.highlights: Considerable amount of new snow that has been transported and is starting to settle. No reports of slabavalanches but weeklayers could exist.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Considerable amount of new snow that has been transported and is starting to settle. No reports of slabavalanches but weeklayers could exist where older snow is underneath or within windslabs/new snow

travelAdvisory.comment: Winter conditions and new or recent snow in most parts. Widely there is loose new snow that can easely drift. Widely there are older windslabs and possible persistent weak layers in multiple aspects. People traveling on steep terrain should be careful and choose conservative routes. Becoming warmer on Monday with precipitation, the snow can get unstable and wet snow problem expected as the day goes on.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Winter conditions, widely older windslabs and possible persistent weak layers in multiple aspects. Becoming warmer on Monday with precipitation, snow can get unstable and wet snow problem expected.

weatherForecast.highlights: Austlæg átt og einhver él til fjalla. Milt í veðri og mögulega rakur snjór

avalancheActivity.comment: Many avlanches a week ago but no recent reports of avalanche activity.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has started to settle but fresh windslabs expected in westerlu aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Considerable new snow came in -NE winds about a week ago and a few dry slabs fell. Snowpit from Seljalandsdalur showed layered windslab and a weekness at about 60 cm depth. Snow should gain strength.

travelAdvisory.comment: Winter conditions and new or recent snow in most parts. Widely there is loose new snow that can easely drift. Widely there are older windslabs and possible persistent weak layers in multiple aspects. People traveling on steep terrain should be careful and choose conservative routes. Becoming warmer on Monday with precipitation, the snow can get unstable and wet snow problem expected as the day goes on.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Winter conditions, widely older windslabs and possible persistent weak layers in multiple aspects. Becoming warmer on Monday with precipitation, snow can get unstable and wet snow problem expected.

weatherForecast.highlights: A-átt of einhver él til fjalla, milt í veðri og hiti yfir frostmarki á láglendi

avalancheActivity.comment: A size 2.5 avalanche was likely released by snowmobilers in Hólsdalur on Dec 30th. An avalanche was reported on S aspect in Ólafsfjörður Dec 31st. Another large avalanche, size 3.5 was released on SW facing aspect in Hestskarðshnjúkur on Dec 30th as well as a few smaller ones. Multiple avalanches released around Ólafsfjörður and above Ólafsfjarðarvegur on the 24th and 25th. An avalanche released in Strengsgil the night before 24.12. and ran over the road Fjarðarvegur. Two avalanches ran over Siglufjarðarvegur late 23.12.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow is present in all elevations and most aspects. The snow is light and drifted into soft slabs on W and N aspects in SE-directions on the 31st of December. Wet avalanches are likely on Monday and Tuesday during warming and natural avalanches are possible. Conservative terrain choices are advised in the mountains.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A lot of snow has been added since before Christmas. Wind slabs have formed since in most aspects, but mostly in S and W aspects after strong south- to easterlies. Cold temperatures in the last days of the year may have stimulated the growth of facets in the snow pack but warming in all elevations on 1st and 2nd of January should strengthen the snow pack as well as decrease temperature gradient in upper elevations. With potential for rain and warming in lower elevations, wet, natural avalanches may release.

travelAdvisory.comment: Winter conditions and new or recent snow in most parts. Widely there is loose new snow that can easely drift. Widely there are older windslabs and possible persistent weak layers in multiple aspects. People traveling on steep terrain should be careful and choose conservative routes. Becoming warmer on Monday with precipitation, the snow can get unstable and wet snow problem expected as the day goes on.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Winter conditions, widely older windslabs and possible persistent weak layers in multiple aspects. Becoming warmer on Monday with precipitation, snow can get unstable and wet snow problem expected.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hlýindi á þriðjudag ná nokkuð hátt til fjalla en næstu daga verður annars úrkomulítið og hægur vindur. Með vikunni kólnar smám saman.

avalancheActivity.comment: Wet avalanche in Skágil and a few wet sluffs.
avalancheActivity.highlights: A lot of new snow in the mountains but rain in lower elevations. Snowfall in easterly winds and cooling later in the week.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Considerable amount of new snow during NE-E winds. Wet snow at lower elevations but dry above aprox. 400 m elevation. Old firn/crust after melt/freeze cycle in some places under the new snow. Snowpit from Oddsskarð showed some facets below the crust.

travelAdvisory.comment: Winter conditions and new or recent snow in most parts. Widely there is loose new snow that can easely drift. Widely there are older windslabs and possible persistent weak layers in multiple aspects. People traveling on steep terrain should be careful and choose conservative routes. Becoming warmer on Monday with precipitation, the snow can get unstable and wet snow problem expected as the day goes on.

weatherForecast.highlights: Spáð er A-snjókomu til fjalla en rigningu neðan til. Minnkandi úrkoma á þriðjudag og miðvikudag. Fremur milt en kólnar svo aftur á miðvikudag og fimmtudag.
